chain_of_thought: [Article Type: Case Report] In this article, I found the following liver injury-related lab values and clinical outcomes: The patient is a 75-year-old female with decompensated cirrhosis. The suspected drug causing liver injury is mycophenolate mofetil (MMF), as dysgeusia began shortly after its initiation and contributed to malnutrition and hepatic decompensation. From the text and tables, I extracted lab results: ALT is not mentioned, AST peak is 108 U/L, ALP peak is 302 U/L, GGT is not mentioned, Bilirubin peak is 1.7 mg/dL (total bilirubin), INR peak is 1.3, and Albumin lowest is 2.4 g/dL. The clinical outcome is improved/discharged, as the patient was discharged with nutritional counseling and showed weight regain and improved grip strength during follow-up.
